Core Statistical Methods for Distributions

Source: R/DistributionDecorator_CoreStatistics.R
CoreStatistics.Rd

Added functionality to distribution objects for numerical statistical methods. Including a generalised expectation function for more complex numerical calculations.

Details

Decorator objects add functionality to the given Distribution object by copying methods in the decorator environment to the chosen Distribution environment. Use the decorate function to decorate a Distribution.

All methods in this decorator use numerical approximations and therefore better results may be available from analytic computations.

Constructor Arguments

ArgumentTypeDetails
distdistributionDistribution to decorate.
R62S3logicalIf TRUE (default), S3 methods are added for decorators in construction.

Public Methods

MethodInput -> OutputDetails
mgf(t)numeric -> numericMoment generating function evaluated at t.
pgf(t)numeric -> numericProbability generating function evaluated at t.
cf(t)numeric -> numericCharacteristic function evaluated at t.
iqr()-> numericInterquartile range of the distribution.
entropy(base = 2)integer -> numericDistribution entropy, Shannon by default.
skewness()-> numericThird stndardised moment of the distribution.
kurtosis(excess = TRUE)logical -> numericFourth standardised moment of the distribution.
By default excess kurtosis (kurtosis - 3).kthmoment(type = "central")character -> numeric
Central (default) or standardised kth moment (type = "standard").genExp(trafo)function -> numeric
Generalised expectation formula. If trafo = NULL, returns arithmetic mean.var()-> numeric
Numeric variance of distribution.cov()-> numeric
Covariance of distribution.cor()-> numeric
Correlation of distribution.mode(which = 1)integer -> numeric

See also

DistributionDecorator

Examples

x = Binomial$new()
decorate(x, CoreStatistics, R62S3 = FALSE)
#> x is now decorated with CoreStatistics
x$iqr()
#> [1] 2

x = Binomial$new(decorators = CoreStatistics, R62S3 = FALSE)
x$kthmoment(4)
#> [1] 17.5
